title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, 22 december [1869]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 22 December [1869]
text: '69 ?DecembeDecember 22Walter deari got your letter yesterday all safe i am obliged to you walterWalter dear but i can doodo without the order till next week if its just as conveinentconvenient for you to send it by wensdayWednesday i would be glad but if it aintain't the week after will doodo George sent me a letter that he wontwon't be home till the last of next week he says he has to work hard but after next week he will have it easier) we have had a very rainy day here to day i haventhaven't made any preperationspreparations for the holidays nor i dontdon't think i shall as you nor georgeGeorge wontwon't be home georgeGeorge may be here new years i have been very lame but to day i can seem to get around better but i am afraid to doodo much for fear i will get bad again) you must try to come home for a week or so if the new man gets in i see an account of it in the papers but i thought it must be judge strong of long island walter you may send me a galaxy if you can just as well as not) mrMr. and mrsMrs. Bruse has gone to washingtonWashington he may probably call to see you if he does it will be to the office) i hope they will find you well and happy walterWalter dear love to mrMr. and mrsMrs. bouroughsBurroughs and the OconersO'Connors also nomorno more at presentyour motherL W Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 22 December [1869]
